column5: something is up, but chances are with all the speculation, we may never really know what. This has been happening all over the planet to some extent.
This has been happening since the beginning of time and every time it occurs, everyone is surprised. Y'know, it might happen again soon eh?
Those long tailed ducks look like "Oldsquaws " to me
Its a government conspiracy trying to hide the coming 2012 armageddon....where's the tin foil?
I like to catch fish so the dieing off of fish is my concern.
I know , I know. I am using the new PC name for those ducks.

isnt it interesting that everytime that dude in the USA says the end of the world is on a certain date....something strange happens shortly after the world keeps existing...( i think i confused myself)....Neva Mind !
After 50 years I wasn't going to change  same with Baltimore Orioles and Marsh Hawks too
i was waiting for someone else to say they felt the same way.Dave, i have heavy duty tin foil in my store.Just remember to put the shiny side faceing out.
looks like free fly tying material to me
Well a fresh 400 to 600 birds washed up today l2p.. get over there !
I actually gave up on tying flies a long time ago

I guess my friend and I better hold off on eating any of the Silver hay day slaughter we pulled out of the Notty on Saturday after that hard rain  because it was not worth our while and should have stayed home to save on gas money.

http://ca.news.yahoo.com/thousands-dead-birds-litter-stretch-georgian-bay-shoreline-202027073.html  I saw about 10 dead birds and 2 big carp on Saturday taking the dogs for a walk near Penetanguishene all in a 100' stretch of beach.  Most of the birds looked like loons but they all were face down in the sand.
Looked like loons, probably cormorants.
I saw about 30 B & W dead ducks on the sand at the mouth of the Notty. The news said botulism from dead fish. I'm wondering if it's ok to eat fish aught from the river??
Health Canada says proper cooking and handling of food eliminates the botulism toxin
So the ducks would be ok to eat then too?
As long as you cook it properly Glen, although not sure I'd be chancing it myself!
...I'd suggest not eating anything you find that is already dead

When we brought the big boat down to Miland from Tobermorey a few weeks back , about half way across in the middle of no where i passed about two dozen dead fish laying on top of the water , some thing weird is going on out there .
Hunters may be shooting and eating ones that are sick.
Daed fish in GBay... just part of the cycle.
understood  agreed , thank you for clearing that up .
That's a 50" musky by the way...  ..what did you see out in the Bay Don?

I've researched this, and nowhere can i find out what kind of birds they are. I can't tell from the picture, but they might be cormorants. Could be loons too....hard to say. I would love to know what they are though.....if anyone is up there and see's this, take a photo of one of the birds for me!!  S.
I don't think they are cormorants -- they look to have white bellies.  Maybe migrating divers?  That would explain the big number as well.

Me and a buddy were on the bay saturday. The 2 birds I saw closely looked to be loons. Saw some other ducks out swimming around looking healthy.   Hopefully this things over and done with seems a little fishy to me that its just botulism...
Obviously 'they' have no clue what killed the birds..........They can't even identify what kind of birds have washed up....
Those look like diver ducks to me. Maybe long tailed.
Let's hope.
We have had a family cottage east of Wasaga, and in my life I have never seen anything like this nor have I seen these types of ducks in the area . Very strange indeed !
I heard it was a mix of Divers, Puddlers, Geese, Gulls, Loons etc..

It was on the A channel news last night, some of those black and white ducks are on their migration south, that's why you don't see them here on a regular basis. There are cormorants, loons, seagulls and others floating and dead on shore.  Too bad it wasn't just cormorants.
Like I said,long tailed ducks. This happens every once in a while.

CTV news just said it was botulism caused by zebra mussels and gobies, stirred up by sturgeon, who washed dead on shore a few months ago (the sturgeon).  This pushed it up higher and now the other birds are eating it.

Growing up and living just north of wasaga,every few years you would get shiners(thousands)on the beach.I Remember birds from time to time washed up on the shore. Ministry always said it was a cycle. We used to have to clean them up ourselves.
A friend heard reports of a fish die off on GB not long before the birds washed up but I never read anything.  If it was botulism wouldn't there be more dead fish than birds?
